New Records: Cleveland tied a franchise record with 83 points in the first half and set a team record with a 41-point halftime lead.
The Cavaliers have already surpassed 130 points five times this season, matching the franchise record.
Key Match Events: Cleveland Cavaliers defeated the Golden State Warriors 136-117.
The Cavaliers scored 136 points on a night when Donovan Mitchell, their best player, shot 4 of 13 and scored only 12 points.
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Kerr and Draymond Green recognized the Cavaliers' playing style as similar to the early Warriors.
Kenny Atkinson's experience with the Warriors made him appealing for the job in Cleveland.
Post-Match Reflections: Draymond Green acknowledged the Cavaliers' ball movement and extra pass strategy.
Steve Kerr praised the Cavaliers as one of the best teams in the league.
Kenny Atkinson highlighted the importance of motion on offense and creating better looks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Evan Mobley's evolution into a wing player has added a new dimension to the Cavaliers.
The Cavaliers are the only team shooting better than 50 percent overall and lead the league in 3-point percentage.
The Cavaliers have the second-best point differential and remain the last unbeaten team with a 10-0 record.
